gui

Class ULTIMATE_USER_INTERFACE

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.ULTIMATE_USER_INTERFACE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class ULTIMATE_USER_INTERFACE
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Creates the soul of the application: The Ultimate User Interface Extends from JFrame, and provides the necessary functions to input data to the database. It has various attributes including TablaModell , InputPanel, JTables, and much more! It has functions to create itself and add the various elements to the Frame.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • addFunctiontoPanelButton

        public void addFunctiontoPanelButton(InputPanel inputpanel,
                                     java.awt.event.ActionListener felvesz,
                                     java.awt.event.ActionListener torol)
        Adds functions to the InputPanel buttons. Every InputPanel has two buttons which can be used to either add data or delete data from the database. Just need to add them functions.
        Parameters:
        inputpanel - the inputpanel
        felvesz - the add function (ActionListener)
        torol - the delete function (ActonListener)

      • makeTab

        protected javax.swing.JComponent makeTab(javax.swing.JPanel inputpanel,
                                         javax.swing.JTable table,
                                         javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel tablemodell)
        The UI is strongly tab based due to space issues.
        Parameters:
        inputpanel - the panel used to input data to the database.
        table - the table which contains the datas.
        tablemodell - the tablemodell which we can use to interact with the table
        Returns:
        a JComponent that can be added to the JTabbedPane

      • makeMenuBar

        public javax.swing.JComponent makeMenuBar()
        Creates the menubar of the application. It also adds functions to the menu items, so the code is a little dense. The Menu has 3 options: Open a save file (Serializer), Save the current state of the database (Serializer) and export the database in Excel (Exportxlsx). Each menu items is supported with an ActionListener which provides the above mentioned functionalities.
        Returns:
        the jComponent which can be added to the User Interface (JFrame)
        See Also:
        Serializer, Exportxlsx

      • createandShowGui

        public void createandShowGui()
        Creates and shows gui. Call this to display the complete JFrame
